reviewText: I'm really glad that I saw Saga perform live when they toured for their first album. They were creating a kind of interesting progressive music that was full of energy and creativity, and they were really fine musicians. After following their next two albums and being quite pleased with their direction, Saga began a shift into a more mainstream sound. The progressive edge they once had was gone. I haven't re-visited Saga until this DVD. This is quite a different band than I saw back in the early 80's. Sure we've all aged, and all things considered the lads from Canada still can manage to pump out some fairly decent sound at their ripe old ages. The performance is a bit uninspired and worst of all suffers from the most annoying aspect, and that is Mike Sadler's constant relinquishing of songs to the audience to fill in the good parts. It's not only self indulgent and egotistical but it's unfair to people that have paid good money to watch Saga perform. The song selection is pretty good and it's no coincidence that the majority of numbers are from the early albums. Here's to days long past.
summary: If I wanted to hear the audience sing...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Definitivamente los grupos como saga permanecen en el mundo del rock por su calidad musical. En el 2003 esta banda canadiense cumplio 25 años de vida artistica y nos regalo este concierto grabado en Bonn Alemania en el que demuestran hasta la saciedad su gran virtuosismo y la brillantes musical que siempre los a caracterizado. En esta presentacion interpretan la gran mayoria de sus temas clasicos mas algunas canciones de sus ultimostrabajos.Hablando un poco del DVD como tal, el sonido nos trae tres fuentes para escojer: estereo PCM, estereo digital y 5.1 al escuchar la presentacion en 5.1 el balance del audio es muy acertado, se escuchan con claridad las voces y los instrumentos. La imagen es muy clara y el manejo de las camaras esta bien logrado. Tal ves a lo unico que le pongo reparo es que entre tema y tema la continuidad se ve interrumpida por un fade a negro algo que puede distraer un poco.Les recomiendo este DVD a todos los amantes del rock progresivo y a aquellos que como yo  hemos seguido a SAGA desde sus comienzos y no hemos tenido la posibilidad de ver esta magnifica banda en vivo.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Incredible to use a word to describe this concert,the band touring Bonn,Germany 2002 w/ then new,"House of Cards" album,a highpoint even by Saga's standards.Included are "new classics" such as hard rockers"Time Bomb","Remember When", & "The One".This stuff is heavy with some amazing tempo changes that Saga have become known for,Ian Crichton is such an criminally underrated guitarist,as the rest of the guys in making it look so effortless & obviously having fun ! Also musically some cool surprises,the resurrection of "A Brief Case",a drum duel between Mike Sadler & Steve Negus that's guaranteed to put a smile on your face.The inclusion of"See them Smile" & "Take it or Leave it" for us old fans as well.A different spin is put on "Time's Up",has the guys doing the tune minstrel style with Jim Gilmour on accordian & Ian Crichton on Mandolin-works really well ! Mike Sadler even straps on the bass for an excellent run through of my all time fav Saga tune"Humble Stance".A must have !
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been a fan of this band since the 80's and have always felt they've been drastically over looked!!! Much more popular in Europe which made the majority of their tours evolve overseas. I was lucky enough to see them in a club in Maine just after their World's Apart cd was released, never fortunate enough to see them again. This show covers a very wide range of their history and was filmed before an intimate crowd. Musically and vocally a terrific show, as they always have been. If you know of the band and can get your hands on this dvd, buy it, you won't be disappointed. "Contact" is also a terrific show caught on film and worth every penny!
summary: Love the band, love the show!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: It would be good if this came with a cd to listen to of it. Performances on this dvd are excellent. The band does look a little uptight at times and there are blank spots in between the songs but it's the live performance that carries this video all the way through.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great live show featuring some great songs. Careful Where You Step opens the show in grand fashion. They also do songs from Full Circle which an ignoramus underrated on Amazon. They do Time Bomb and it rocks. I don't care what fools say-for my money, Saga is the best prog band out there. Fools criticize them because their musical vistas are limited by Weird Al ventures and metal bore fandangalos.
summary: One of my favorite groups...Awesome Live
